summary: Introduced in the House of Representatives, this bill (H.R. 323) proposes to rename a United States Postal Service facility in honor of a police officer. The legislation designates the post office located at 80 Prospect Street in Avon, New York, as the “Officer Anthony Mazurkiewicz Memorial Post Office Building.” Sponsored by a bipartisan group of New York representatives, the bill ensures that any official reference in laws, maps, documents, or other records to this facility will henceforth use the new memorial name.
